meanings.definition: An entrance or opening into a building or room.
meanings.sent1: The doorways of the house were painted blue.
meanings.sent2: People walked through the doorways of the museum to see the exhibits.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat in the doorway, blocking anyone from entering.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the doorway to her kind heart.
meanings.sent5: The grand doorway of the castle was adorned with intricate carvings.

meanings.definition: A passage or way into or out of a place.
meanings.sent1: The narrow doorways of the maze led to dead ends.
meanings.sent2: The secret doorway in the wall revealed a hidden garden.
meanings.sent3: The doorway to adventure beckoned them with a mysterious glow.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the doorway of the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The doorway to success requires hard work and determination.

meanings.definition: A threshold or point of entry.
meanings.sent1: Stepping through the doorway, she entered a world of magic.
meanings.sent2: The doorway to the new year was marked by fireworks and cheers.
meanings.sent3: The doorway to knowledge is always open for those who seek it.
meanings.sent4: The doorway to friendship is paved with trust and understanding.
meanings.sent5: The doorway to opportunity awaited him at the top of the hill.
